data:
Context/Background
Glenurquhart Primary School is a Highland Council school situated near Inverness.  The 102 pupils are taught in 5 English medium classes.  The school is managed by a non-teaching Head Teacher.  The school delivers the Curriculum for Excellence and is committed to the teaching of modern languages throughout P1-P7.

Objectives
To be in line with the national and local authority 1+2 policies for modern languages.
To develop communicative competence and confidence.
To make explicit the interconnected nature of languages.
To develop active global citizenship.
To develop best practice in the assessment and moderation of modern language learning.

Participant Profile
The nominated person to attend the immersion course is Miss Kirstine Mullin.  She is the school's principal teacher.  She currently teaches P6/7 and mentors a newly qualified teacher.  She has led various language and literacy training activities within the Area School Group (ASG.)  She completed the 12 day MLPS training course in June 2016.
Miss Mullin has volunteered to attend the immersion course.  She will continue to develop her planning, teaching and assessment practise in the lead up to the course itself, noting reflections in her learning journal.  This will result in a list of questions to consider during the LFEE course, making best use of the experts.

Methodology/Activities
Throughout June 2017 - preparation phase - To improve Miss Mullin's understanding of the geography of the local area, To undertake preparation for professional dialogue, To further develop competence in French (professional reading, online language tools.)
July 2017 - attendance at LFEE Primary immersion course  in France
Attending the LFEE Primary Immersion Course will allow Miss Mullin to:
* improve methodological expertise in the teaching of French to young learners
* provide her with materials and ideas suitable for the teaching of French at primary level
* develop cultural awareness and understanding of contemporary France
* improve her competence and performance in French
* use Internet and other ICT resources in her class
(http://lfee.net/immersion-courses/immersion-courses-in-france/)

July 2017 - June 2018 - dissemination phase - To develop a Modern Languages progression for our ASG, to design assessment tools , to share new methodologies & resources with ASG colleagues, to develop moderation within the ASG, to pursue Professional Recognition (collegiate activity time, management time, professional dialogue, learning log-quality assured by HT.)

Medium Term Impact
Improved planning, teaching and assessment methodologies for modern languages within school and ASG.
Increased pupil engagement and enjoyment.
French will be taught in a more ad hoc way, embedded across the curriculum.  Links between languages will be made clearer to pupils.
School resources will be labeled bilingually (French / English.)
School assembly about immersion experience - parents to be invited.  Blog entry on school website.
Greater cultural awareness - transferred to pupils.
Put all new resources on shared drive within school, to help learning and teaching throughout the school / ASG.
Develop regular global citizenship activities across school.

Potential Longer Term Benefits
Development of moderation of French across the ASG.
Engagement in cross-sector professional dialogue about the teaching of modern languages.  Miss Mullin will encourage peer visits so that colleagues can see new methodologies in action.
Any links made with other European teachers will help to improve the awareness of other cultures and languages across the ASG. Programme of international, cultural events throughout the school year.
